Name: Anonymous royal head
Description: This anonymous royal head bears a resemblance to a statuette found in the valley temple of Menkaure/Mycerinus at Giza. It could be a representation of king Shepseskaf, who completed the funerary complex of his predecessor. The king wears a type of horizontally folded hairband which extends down to the top of the eyebrows, and on top of it is an uraeus. The face is very delicately modelled, with round eyes, a forced smile, and a strong chin.
